alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 11:50AM CDT until May 15 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 145 PM CDT. * At 1150 AM CDT, emergency management reported flooding across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have already fallen. The expected rainfall rate with additional showers approaching from the west is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. These showers could result in additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch in the warned area over the next 90 minutes and lead to an extended period of flash flooding. Several roads are already closed due to high water. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seminole. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
